title: Why do all pro elo players look like proper nerds? Should i stick to regular physical sport?
body: If i don't have the physic for playing lol, (i.e. Nerd look) am i doomed from making gold at least?  Do i have too much strength in the fingers which could make me hit the wrong key? Or should I get glasses to intensify my lol experience? Or is it just normal that natural sportsman cant play esports? Does anyone know of pro level physical sportsman who play pro level esports as well?

replies.body: Actually good athletes tend to be naturally better at esports than fat slobs, we're just too busy playing sport and having sex with women to get REALLY good at them.

$100 a week WAFL colts.
im guessing you have never seen sexpeke then

The only problem i've ever had while joining sports and LoL was a small accident at the dojo that costed me some shoulder mobility for a couple weeks.

...on the other hand, i could see how someone might incur in wrist problems while playing LoL and that would impact on some exercises.

Basically, as long as you don't get hurt, you're fine.

edit: at least i had insurance :P

Why the hell would you wanna change your appearance to align with stereotypes (assuming you're as attractive as you so claimed)?

If you do more, you get better. It's the fundamental law of almost everything, gaming included.

It's just that most people gain weights and grow bad eye sights along the way while trying to achieve something in gaming, it's a give and take thing in this particular activity. 

If you can manage otherwise, then by all means go for it.

Put up a picture (with timestamp) or else this thread is pointless.

You could look like a trashy little nerd as well, and nobody would know.
Burgerson is actually really sexy, I would tap him all day and night.
